com.burstly.lib.component
Class AbstractAdaptor

java.lang.Object
  com.burstly.lib.component.AbstractAdaptor
All Implemented Interfaces:
IBurstlyAdaptor
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractBurstlyAdaptor
public abstract class AbstractAdaptor
extends Object
implements IBurstlyAdaptor

Abstraction of adaptor.
NOTE: Before calling any logics in the third party listeners you should check on stopped adaptor. Use onStopped method.

Author:
Alexey Redinskii

getNewAd

public final View getNewAd()
Description copied from interface: IBurstlyAdaptor
Requests a new ad. You should return view implementation and then using IBurstlyAdaptorListener.didLoad(String, boolean) or IBurstlyAdaptorListener.failedToLoad(String, boolean, String) callbacks notify platform about the result of calling for ad. If next ad will be an interstitial ad, this method should return null.
Important to notice that ad loading mechanism must be able to load ads when the returned view does not attached to layout or it is hidden. This is the "must have" condition for implementation. This method is executed in the main UI thread.

Specified by:
getNewAd in interface IBurstlyAdaptor
Returns:
View view that implements your ad

setHardwareAcceleration

protected void setHardwareAcceleration(View view)
Set hardware acceleration flag set on server.

Parameters:
view - View

protected abstract View doGetNewAd()
Request and return a new ad instance.

Returns:

startTransaction

public void startTransaction(Map<String,?> paramsFromServer)
                      throws IllegalArgumentException
Description copied from interface: IBurstlyAdaptor
Ad processing entry point. This method is invoked at the beginning of a new ad transaction.
Method is executed in the main UI thread.

Specified by:
startTransaction in interface IBurstlyAdaptor
Parameters:
paramsFromServer - Map of parameters that came from ad server to configure ad showing logic
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - should be thrown if parameters are invalid and can not be processed correctly

getLayoutParamsResolver

protected LayoutParametersResolver getLayoutParamsResolver()
Get current layout params resolver.

Returns:
LayoutParametersResolver for current response

endTransaction

public void endTransaction(IBurstlyAdaptor.TransactionCode endCode)
Description copied from interface: IBurstlyAdaptor
Last method of the ad processing lifecycle.
This method is executed in the main UI thread.

Specified by:
endTransaction in interface IBurstlyAdaptor
Parameters:
endCode - IBurstlyAdaptor.TransactionCode end code.
Codes are:
  • IBurstlyAdaptor.TransactionCode.CODE_SUCCESS
  • IBurstlyAdaptor.TransactionCode.CODE_FAILED
  • IBurstlyAdaptor.TransactionCode.CODE_CANCELLED

getParamsFromServer

Returns:
the paramsFromServer

precacheInterstitialAd

public void precacheInterstitialAd()
Description copied from interface: IBurstlyAdaptor
Precache interstitial ad (including fullscreen video ads).You should return view implementation and then using IBurstlyAdaptorListener.didLoad(String, boolean) or IBurstlyAdaptorListener.failedToLoad(String, boolean, String) callbacks notify Burstly sdk about the result of the precaching.This method is executed in the main UI thread.

Specified by:
precacheInterstitialAd in interface IBurstlyAdaptor

showPrecachedInterstitialAd

public void showPrecachedInterstitialAd()
Description copied from interface: IBurstlyAdaptor
Shows previously precached interstitial ad. This is the place where standart lifecycle for the ad (if any) should be started.
This method is executed in the main UI thread.

Specified by:
showPrecachedInterstitialAd in interface IBurstlyAdaptor

isStopped

public boolean isStopped()
Returns:
true if adaptor stopped, false - otherwise.
NOTE: Necessarily do this check before calling any logics in the third party listeners.

isDestroyed

protected boolean isDestroyed()
Returns:
true if adaptor destroyed, false - otherwise.

startViewSession

public void startViewSession()
Description copied from interface: IBurstlyAdaptor
Fires before attaching adaptor view to Burslty layout. Adaptor view is visible after this method invocation and is attached to a view hierarchy.

Specified by:
startViewSession in interface IBurstlyAdaptor

endViewSession

public void endViewSession()
Description copied from interface: IBurstlyAdaptor
Fires before deattaching adaptor view from Burslty layout. Adaptor view is not visible after this method invocation and is deattached to a view hierarchy.

Specified by:
endViewSession in interface IBurstlyAdaptor
